text: The Syr Darya sturgeon (Pseudoscaphirhynchus fedtschenkoi) is a species of sturgeon native to Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, and Uzbekistan. There is a very small number of individuals, so it could probably be "extinct". It is from the genus Pseudoscaphirhynchus. IUCN lists this fish as a critically endangered species. Before, it used to live in the Aral Sea, but that lake has dried up already. == References == # Mugue, N. & Karimov, B. (2022). "Pseudoscaphirhynchus fedtschenkoi". IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. # "Pseudoscaphirhynchus fedtschenkoi". FishBase. Category:IUCN Red List critically endangered species Category:Acipenseriformes Category:Ray-finned fish Category:Freshwater fish Category:Animals of Asia Category:Critically endangered species
title: Syr Darya sturgeon
